channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: Govt Urged to Act on Surge in Cheap Imported Steel
item.description: The Australian steel industry has requested emergency trade relief measures to counter a surge in low-priced imported fabricated steelwork threatening local manufacturers. The Australian Steel Institute highlighted significant business closures and reduced capacity utilization due to competition from cheap imports, urging government intervention to preserve domestic steel production capacity.

item.title: Iron Ore Prices Forecast to Ease
item.description: Iron ore prices are expected to decline in 2026 due to increased supply from new projects and ongoing demand pressure from China. Despite low inventories supporting prices currently, factors such as steel production curbs and weak Chinese demand are forecasted to weigh on prices, with a long-term decline projected through 2034.

item.title: Copper breaks above $11,000 on increased likelihood of US rate cut
item.description: Copper prices rose to their highest level in almost a month, reaching $11,025 per metric ton on Wednesday. The rally was driven by increased expectations for a US Federal Reserve rate cut, with CME's FedWatch Tool showing over 84% probability of a 25 basis point cut in December.

item.title: Highland Copper Partial Project Equity Transfer Overnight LME Copper Surged Significantly
item.description: LME copper opened at $10,992.5/mt and touched a high of $11,009.5/mt in early trading on Thursday, November 27, 2025. The contract closed at $10,953/mt, up 1.11%, with trading volume at 22,000 lots.

item.title: Mercuria's copper bull forecasts more price records next year
item.description: A squeeze in global copper markets is expected to tighten again next year, pushing prices of concentrate and refined metal to new records. Market analysts forecast continued upward pressure on copper prices due to supply constraints.

item.title: Comex copper premium here to stay, LME executive says
item.description: An LME executive stated that the copper price premium on the US Comex exchange over the London Metal Exchange is likely to persist over the next 18 months. This premium reflects structural differences in the two markets.

item.title: UBS raises copper outlook as mine disruptions deepen supply deficits
item.description: UBS lowered its refined copper production growth estimates to 1.2% for 2025 and 2.2% for 2026 due to declining ore grades and operational challenges at mines, signaling deeper supply deficits in the copper market.

item.title: Mitsubishi Materials to cut primary copper smelting volume by 30% to 40% by 2035
item.description: Japan's Mitsubishi Materials announced plans to reduce its primary copper smelting volume by 30% to 40% by 2035, reflecting strategic adjustments in copper production capacity over the next decade.

item.title: LME nickel prices rise to 2-week high
item.description: Despite recent losses and a market closure, LME nickel futures rebounded, closing at $15,285 per ton, up $185 from the previous session. The recovery comes amid ongoing volatility and oversupply concerns in the nickel market.

item.title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
item.description: Nickel prices remained volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized in Q3, with ongoing oversupply concerns continuing to weigh on the market. The article reviews recent trends and factors influencing nickel prices over the past quarter.

item.title: Unleashing sustainable nickel production for a net zero future
item.description: This article explores how optimizing nickel production, particularly through High Pressure Acid Leaching (HPAL), can create a more sustainable battery industry with a lower carbon footprint. It highlights efforts in pollution prevention, biodiversity conservation, waste management, and stakeholder engagement to advance sustainable nickel production aligned with global net-zero goals.

item.title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
item.description: French start-up Genomines secured $45 million in Series A funding to scale its innovative method of extracting nickel from plants instead of traditional mining. This approach promises faster, cheaper, and cleaner nickel production with higher purity and productivity, and the company is piloting projects with major automakers and battery manufacturers.

item.title: Aluminum fell to 2,833.25 USD/T on November 27, 2025
item.description: Aluminum prices declined 1.34% to $2,833.25 per tonne on November 27, 2025, continuing a downward trend over the past month with a 2.29% decline. Despite recent weakness, aluminum remains 9.50% higher than a year ago, with prices rebounding from a near-one-month low of $2,790 reached on November 18th as macroeconomic tailwinds from Fed rate cut signals and Beijing stimulus measures lifted base metals.

item.title: SMM: Three-Region Aluminum Ingot Inventory Falls to 441000 mt as of Nov 28
item.description: Aluminum ingot inventory across three regions has declined to 441,000 mt. Secondary aluminum alloy prices are expected to fluctuate within a range in the short term, with price resilience remaining stable.

item.title: Top news on China steel and other commodity markets
item.description: Retail inventories of major carbon steel items in China have declined recently but at a slower pace. The report also highlights steady iron ore prices and procurement trends, suggesting cautious market activity amid fluctuating demand and supply conditions.

item.title: Copper prices rise after Nvidia's results, but the dollar is still strong
item.description: Copper prices edged up following strong earnings from Nvidia, with the LME three-month copper price rising 0.3% to $10,784 per metric ton. However, a strong US dollar and weak demand from China, including a 22.1% annual drop in copper cathode imports, continue to weigh on the market. Analysts expect ongoing consolidation after recent price setbacks.

item.title: [Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices dropped slightly on November 27, US extends some tariff exemptions for China
item.description: Nickel prices slightly declined on November 27, with the SMM #1 refined nickel average price dropping to 119,000 yuan/mt, down 850 yuan/mt from the previous day. Futures on SHFE also fell by 0.35%-0.61%. Market sentiment was influenced by dovish signals from US Fed officials and positive China-US diplomatic communications, though long-term price pressure remains.

item.title: FLASH: Nickel 28 reports 34.33% rise in Q3 2025 nickel production
item.description: Nickel 28 announced a 34.33% year-on-year increase in nickel production at the Ramu nickel-cobalt project in Papua New Guinea for Q3 2025, producing 9,242 tonnes of nickel contained in mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP). Cobalt production also rose to 887 tonnes. The project benefited from no unplanned outages or scheduled maintenance, with net cash costs at $3.07 per pound of nickel produced.

item.title: Nickel 28 Releases Ramu Q3 2025 Operating Performance
item.description: Nickel 28 reported strong Q3 2025 results with 9,242 tonnes of contained nickel and 887 tonnes of cobalt produced in MHP, surpassing last year's figures. Nickel sales reached 9,880 tonnes, exceeding production and reducing inventory. CEO Craig Lennon highlighted uninterrupted production and expects continued strong sales into Q4 2025 despite a slight decrease in average nickel prices.

item.title: Lifezone Metals Advances Kabanga Nickel Project Toward 2026 Final Investment Decision
item.description: Lifezone Metals is progressing the Kabanga Nickel Project with a targeted final investment decision (FID) in late 2026. The project holds about 50 million tons of reserves at 1.9-2% nickel grades and offers robust economics with a $1.6 billion NPV and 23.3% IRR. The project uses a hydrometallurgical process with renewable energy, aiming for sustainable nickel production aligned with tightening environmental regulations.

item.title: Denarius Metals Announces Details for the November 30, 2025 Interest Payments
item.description: Denarius Metals reported ongoing mining operations at its Zancudo Project in Colombia and holds interests in several critical mineral projects in Spain, including the Aguablanca nickel-copper mine and the Lomero polymetallic deposit. The company is advancing its portfolio with a focus on copper and other critical minerals, supporting supply amid global demand.

item.title: Nickel Hits 31-week Low as Oversupply Mounts
item.description: Nickel prices have dropped to a 31-week low due to persistent oversupply, mainly driven by Indonesia's expanded production. Despite regulatory moves to restrict new refining permits, supply remains high, with LME warehouse stockpiles increasing significantly this year.

item.title: Fastmarkets launches European aluminium scrap shredded old sheet taint tabor price assessment
item.description: Fastmarkets launched a new price assessment for European aluminium scrap shredded old sheet on Friday, November 28, 2025, following a consultation period that began on October 29 and concluded on November 26. This development reflects ongoing efforts to establish standardized pricing mechanisms in the aluminum scrap market.

item.title: Researchers make incredible breakthrough using material from old cars
item.description: A new recycled aluminum alloy called RidgeAlloy has been developed to address the challenge of recycling aluminum from old cars. This alloy is tough and can be produced rapidly, reducing energy use by up to 95% compared to primary aluminum processing, thus significantly lowering environmental impact.

item.title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever debut carbon-free aluminium aerosol packaging
item.description: Ahead of COP30, Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever launched an aerosol can made with 50% ELYSIS aluminium and 50% recycled content, eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions through the ELYSIS process. This breakthrough could transform sustainable packaging in personal and home care sectors.

item.title: United States clean energy spending reaches a new high on EV surge, solar boom, and rising aluminium usage
item.description: The surge in electric vehicle production in the US has increased demand for automotive-grade, low-carbon aluminium, which helps reduce emissions in EV parts. Manufacturers are raising recycled aluminium content to meet stricter emissions standards and consumer demand for sustainability.

item.title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers
item.description: Phinergy's aluminum-air backup energy technology was selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers to accelerate clean backup energy adoption. This technology offers a scalable, clean alternative to diesel generators, supporting net-zero operations in data centers.

item.title: Low-Carbon Metal Premiums: Market Trends & Price Evolution
item.description: Sustainability premiums for low-carbon metals like aluminum are rising due to corporate decarbonization commitments and innovations such as renewable energy integration and inert anode technology. These trends are driving demand for low-carbon aluminum in automotive, electronics, and construction sectors.

item.title: Latest Update in the SMM Steel Billet Market
item.description: Steel billet inventory in major stainless steel markets slightly increased by 0.64% week-on-week, indicating a limited supply-demand imbalance. Despite some recovery in stainless steel transactions, market sentiment remains weak with persistent destocking pressure and sluggish sales expected to limit steel price gains in December.

item.title: Daily Topic of China Bulk Commodity Data (November 28, 2025)
item.description: On November 27, 2025, steel commodities showed a month-on-month price decline among eight steel products, contributing to a broader trend of price decreases in the steel sector. The overall commodity price index remained stable but significantly below its cycle peak, indicating ongoing market pressure.

item.title: Fastmarkets amends Europe stainless steel scrap price assessments to domestic from import
item.description: Fastmarkets changed its Europe stainless steel scrap price assessments from import to domestic delivery terms due to sporadic imports and more consistent domestic market liquidity. This adjustment aims to provide a more relevant pricing tool reflecting current market conditions.

item.title: JSW Steel Share Price Live Updates: JSW Steel's Final Trading Price
item.description: JSW Steel's stock price showed a slight downturn with a -0.8% return for the week, indicating some negative market sentiment or pressure on steel sector equities.

item.title: Steel prices in the fourth week of November 2025 - Arab Iron and Steel
item.description: Russian hot-rolled coil prices dropped by $15 to $430–445/ton FOB, while Chinese cold-rolled coil prices remained stable, reflecting regional variations in steel price trends during the fourth week of November.

item.title: Minister Sidhu reinforces commitment to Canada's steel industry
item.description: Canada's Minister of International Trade, Maninder Sidhu, will participate in an event highlighting the country's ongoing commitment to the steel industry, signaling government support and engagement with the sector.

item.title: Steel news and insights about steel market - steel prices - GMK Center
item.description: Recent updates include a 3% year-on-year increase in global stainless steel production for January-September 2025, Spain's 5.4% production increase in the first half of 2025, and ArcelorMittal's temporary blast furnace shutdown in Poland due to import pressures. Other news covers price adjustments, production changes, and trade measures affecting steel markets worldwide.

item.title: SunSirs: Copper Prices Skyrocket by 20,000 RMB/Ton
item.description: Copper prices have surged by over 20,000 RMB per ton this year, reaching historic highs above $11,200 per ton on the LME and nearly 90,000 RMB per ton on the Shanghai Futures Exchange. This price boom supports increased processing of lower-grade copper ores. The rise is driven by demand from emerging industries and strong upstream production.

item.title: Base Metal Prices Face Growth Uncertainty
item.description: TD Securities expects London-traded copper to maintain recent gains into 2026 following a record high in October. Aluminium and zinc prices show mixed outlooks, while nickel faces oversupply concerns. The forecast reflects cautious sentiment amid evolving economic and supply-demand factors in the base metals market.

item.title: BHP bets big on Chile's copper boom
item.description: BHP's Escondida mine increased copper output by 4% to 494,000 tonnes in FY26, driven by record throughput and improved recoveries. Copper demand is forecast to rise 70% between 2021 and 2050, positioning Chile as a key supplier. The ramp-up of new projects like the Full SaL project supports production growth amid strong market demand.

item.title: Copper breaks above USD11,000 on increased likelihood of US rate cut
item.description: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange rose 1.3% to $10,963 per metric ton amid growing expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut. The price surge reflects optimism about softer monetary policy supporting industrial metals demand.

item.title: The Cascabel Copper-Gold Mine Is Expected to Commence Production in 2028
item.description: SolGold has accelerated development of its Cascabel copper-gold project in northern Ecuador, with preliminary engineering set to begin in 2026 and first production expected in 2028. The news comes amid fluctuating copper prices and shifting global supply dynamics.

item.title: BHP bets big on Chile's copper boom
item.description: BHP's Escondida mine in Chile started the 2025–26 financial year with a 4% increase in copper output, reaching 494,000 tonnes. The company is expanding production amid rising global demand and ongoing infrastructure developments.

item.title: Copper smelters idle as China slows
item.description: Global copper smelting activity declined in October, with inactive capacity rising to 15.1% of world nameplate—the highest this year. China drove most of the decline, with inactivity jumping to 13.8%, while other regions saw modest improvements.

item.title: China's overcapacity crackdown reaches copper, but market impact unlikely
item.description: China has shelved several planned copper smelters as part of its overcapacity crackdown, but the move is not expected to significantly impact the market. The government's actions are aimed at curbing excess industrial capacity.

item.title: On November 28, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 117,000-122,000 yuan/mt, with an average price of 119,500 yuan/mt, up 500 yuan/mt from the previous day
item.description: Nickel prices rebounded slightly on November 28, with the SMM #1 refined nickel average price rising by 500 yuan/mt to 119,500 yuan/mt. This indicates a short-term recovery following the previous day's decline, reflecting ongoing market fluctuations.

item.title: Base Metal Prices Face Growth Uncertainty
item.description: TD Securities forecasts nickel prices to plateau in 2026 amid global economic growth concerns and potential delays in US interest rate cuts. While Beijing’s stimulus measures may support demand, nickel faces oversupply worries. A modest price rebound is expected in 2027, reflecting cautious market sentiment.

item.title: Base Metal Prices Face Growth Uncertainty
item.description: Financial firm TD Securities forecasts nickel prices to plateau in 2026 with a modest rebound expected in 2027. The outlook reflects concerns about oversupply and cautious market sentiment amid various economic and supply-demand factors affecting base metals.

item.title: China's Nickel-Free EV Batteries Hit Indonesia's Nickel Plan
item.description: A new report from Energy Shift Institute highlights how China's development of nickel-free electric vehicle batteries is impacting Indonesia's nickel strategy, potentially affecting demand and market dynamics for nickel producers.

item.title: Low-Carbon Metal Premiums: Market Trends & Price Evolution
item.description: The London Metal Exchange (LME) is advancing initiatives to establish low-carbon price premiums for nickel and other metals, incentivizing sustainable production. This market-based mechanism supports decarbonization by financially rewarding environmentally friendly production methods, driven by demand from automotive and battery manufacturing sectors.

item.title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
item.description: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue and earnings above forecasts, driven by strong growth in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments. The company’s performance in North America and Europe, along with a stable high-voltage backlog, supports optimism for future growth, with analysts noting potential benefits from copper tariffs in 2026.

item.title: Aluminum rose to 2,873.60 USD/T on November 28, 2025
item.description: Aluminum prices increased to $2,873.60 per tonne on November 28, 2025, up 1.42% from the previous day. The rise was driven by macroeconomic tailwinds as key Fed officials signaled support for additional rate cuts and Beijing announced fresh stimulus measures. Over the past month, aluminum prices have fallen 0.38%, but remain 9.51% higher than a year ago.

item.title: Aluminum price hits three-year high as US-China truce buoys outlook
item.description: Aluminum futures on the London Metal Exchange rose 0.6% to settle at $2,902 per metric ton, reaching the highest level since May 2022. The rally is supported by tightening supply in China due to state-imposed production caps and an improving demand outlook as trade tensions ease between the US and China.

item.title: Global alumina production in Oct up 4% on month, says Aluminium Institute
item.description: Global alumina production rose nearly 4% month-on-month to 13.37 million tonnes in October, with China accounting for 62% of global output at 8.21 million tonnes. Production across regions showed growth, with Oceania up over 5%, Africa and Asia (excluding China) up nearly 4%, and global primary aluminium production up nearly 4% to 6.3 million tonnes.

item.title: Aluminum Rod: Inventory Drawdown, Fees Bottoming Out; Cable Operating Rate Up
item.description: Domestic aluminum rod producers' inventory days decreased to 6.68 days as of November 28, 2025, indicating an inventory drawdown trend with eased supply-side pressure. Aluminum cable operating rate rose to 63%, continuing its moderate recovery trend, though demand weakness persists with year-end approaching and winter temperatures constraining project progress.

item.title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
item.description: Steel rebar futures in China rose above CNY 3,100 per tonne, reaching the highest level so far in November as lower supply returned to buyers' attention. Crude steel output in China fell 12% annually in October, the lowest for the month since 2021, consistent with China's pledges to cap industries suffering from overcapacity.

item.title: Copper rose to 5.19 USD/Lbs on November 28, 2025, up 2.15% from the previous day
item.description: Copper prices reached 5.19 USD per pound, marking a 2.15% increase from the previous day and a four-week high. The rise is attributed to record-high premiums offered by Chilean producer Codelco to US buyers and expectations of aggressive US Federal Reserve rate cuts, reinforcing a bullish market outlook.

item.title: Comex Copper Ends the Month 2.37% Higher at $5.1855 — Data Talk
item.description: Front-month Comex Copper for December delivery closed at $5.1855 per pound, up 2.37% for the month and marking its fourth consecutive monthly gain. The price remains below its 2025 high but is up nearly 30% from the previous year, reflecting strong market momentum.

item.title: Codelco offers US clients copper at record premiums above $500/t
item.description: Chilean copper producer Codelco has offered US customers copper at record premiums exceeding $500 per metric ton, signaling a shift in supply priorities and reinforcing market expectations of a tightening copper market. This move is seen as a response to shifting global trade flows and robust demand.

item.title: Taseko Mines (TGB) Posts Mixed Q3 Performance with Increased Copper Production
item.description: Taseko Mines reported increased copper production and revenue in Q3 2025 despite a slight decrease in adjusted EPS. Operational improvements, reduced costs, and successful equity financing have strengthened the company's financial position, with positive outlooks for production growth and efficiency in 2026 amid strong copper market conditions.

item.title: China's Jiangxi Copper Rejected by SolGold in $1 Billion Takeover Approach
item.description: SolGold's $1 billion takeover bid for China's Jiangxi Copper was rejected, indicating ongoing strategic positioning and consolidation attempts within the copper industry. This development reflects competitive dynamics in copper production and corporate control in China.

item.title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Nickel prices fell to 14,822.63 USD/ton on November 28, down 0.12% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have declined by 3.78%, and are down 7.41% compared to the same time last year.

item.title: Nickel inches down ahead of Fed's decision
item.description: Nickel prices edged lower on November 28 as the US dollar strengthened and Goldman Sachs forecast a further decline to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026. Market expectations for a Fed rate cut in December remain high.

item.title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
item.description: Aluminum prices rose to $2,873.60 per tonne on November 28, 2025, up 1.42% from the previous day, rebounding from a near one-month low. Despite a slight monthly decline of 0.38%, prices remain 10.48% higher than a year ago, supported by macroeconomic factors including potential rate cuts and stimulus measures in China.

item.title: Aluminum Rod: Inventory Drawdown, Fees Bottoming Out; Cable Operating Rate Up, Demand Weakness Persistent (SMM Analysis)
item.description: As of late November 2025, aluminum rod inventory days decreased to 6.68, signaling a drawdown trend and easing supply pressure. Processing fees remain low, and while cable operating rates improved slightly, demand remains weak due to seasonal and year-end factors.

item.title: AI Data Centers Crush Aluminum Industry with Power Demand
item.description: US aluminum smelters are struggling to compete for electricity as tech giants pay premium rates to power AI data centers, increasing pressure on aluminum production capacity and raising concerns about future supply.

item.title: HRC Steel Hits 31-week Low
item.description: HRC Steel prices rose to 904 USD/T on November 28, 2025, up 0.33% from the previous day, with a 6.73% monthly increase and a 29.14% year-on-year rise. However, the price recently hit a 31-week low, reflecting ongoing volatility in the global steel market.

item.title: Copper Firms on Codelco Premium Push
item.description: Copper prices rose to 5.19 USD/lb on November 28, 2025, up 2.15% from the previous day, as Chilean producer Codelco offered record-high premiums to Chinese buyers, signaling a shift in market dynamics. The move reinforces a bullish outlook due to a fragile supply-demand balance and expectations of further US Federal Reserve rate cuts.

item.title: Copper price in London hits new high amid bullish calls
item.description: Copper prices in London reached a record high of $11,210.50 per ton amid bullish sentiment from industry leaders at an Asia gathering, citing tightening supply and the risk of global copper cathode shortages. US copper futures also surged, reflecting strong demand and supply disruptions.

item.title: US November PCE Lower than Expected, Copper Price Running at Highs
item.description: LME copper prices rose overnight to a high of $10,450 per metric ton, supported by weaker-than-expected US PCE data and expectations of rate cuts. The market remains tight, with prices reflecting ongoing supply constraints and strong demand.

item.title: Copper Market Outlook
item.description: J.P. Morgan forecasts copper prices to rise to $12,500 per metric ton in Q2 2026, driven by severe supply disruptions and a projected global refined copper deficit. The market is expected to remain tight, with higher prices likely to persist through 2026.

item.title: Copper Market Outlook
item.description: Severe supply disruptions, including a fatal mudslide at Indonesia's Grasberg mine and downgraded production at Chile's Quebrada Blanca mine, have tightened the copper market and driven prices higher. J.P. Morgan projects copper prices to reach $12,500/mt in Q2 2026, with a global refined copper deficit of approximately 330,000 metric tons expected in 2026. The report highlights ongoing supply challenges and potential constraints on Chinese refined copper production.

item.title: Foran Mining advances rare tier-one copper asset in Saskatchewan
item.description: Foran Mining is progressing its tier-one copper asset in Saskatchewan, with plans for feasibility studies and construction targeted for 2027 and 2028 respectively, highlighting ongoing development in copper production capacity in North America.

item.title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
item.description: Nickel prices fell 1.8% to $15,235 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, hitting a four-year low. The decline is driven by a gloomy outlook from the Federal Reserve and concerns over oversupply despite Indonesia's potential mining quota cuts. The metal has dropped about 8% this year due to new supply from Indonesia and slower electric vehicle sales.

item.title: Nickel has a future despite low prices
item.description: Nickel prices are at a five-year low, down 9.5% year-on-year, reaching levels not seen since October 2020. Oversupply remains a key issue despite government regulations restricting new smelter investments and planned ore output quota cuts for 2026. Stainless steel demand remains subdued, especially in Asia, but the long-term outlook is supported by growth in electric vehicle markets.

item.title: Samsung's T7 Resurrected SSD Uses 100% Recycled Aluminum
item.description: Samsung has launched the T7 Resurrected portable SSD, the first in the storage industry to use 100% recycled aluminum sourced from Galaxy smartphone production scraps. The product eliminates the coloring process, showcasing the natural aluminum finish and reducing chemical use, while packaging is made from 100% recycled paper and soy ink. The SSD has already won the 2026 CES Innovation Award in the Sustainability & Energy category.

item.title: Samsung Launches New SSD T7 Resurrected
item.description: Samsung's new T7 Resurrected SSD features a body case made entirely from recycled aluminum generated during Galaxy smartphone production, promoting cross-division resource circulation. The manufacturing process avoids coloring, highlighting the natural luster of aluminum and minimizing chemical use, with packaging made from 100% recycled paper and soy ink. The product received the 2026 CES Innovation Award in the Sustainability & Energy category.

item.title: Green Steelmaking Innovation: Tech & Climate Impact 2025
item.description: Green steelmaking using hydrogen technology is revolutionizing manufacturing by cutting emissions by 85-95%. Innovations include electric arc furnace optimization, molten oxide electrolysis, and advanced material handling systems, supported by government investments such as Australia's $500 million Green Iron Investment Fund. Leading countries like those in Europe are advancing commercial-scale hydrogen-based steel production through initiatives like HYBRIT.

item.title: How decarbonizing steel build a greener future
item.description: Steel production is undergoing significant innovation to reduce carbon emissions, including electric arc furnaces using less fossil fuel and green hydrogen-based processes. The UAE's Masdar and EMSTEEL have launched a pilot project producing green steel with up to 95% CO₂ emission reduction. Government support and market education are key to overcoming the higher costs of green steel and driving demand for sustainable steel products.

item.title: Building a sustainable metals industry
item.description: The steel industry is advancing sustainability through electrification, automation, and digitalization to reduce environmental impact. Events like STEEL TECH 2025 highlight innovations such as the world's first 100% green hydrogen ladle preheater and new electric arc furnace projects, demonstrating industry commitment to sustainable steel production.

item.title: Canada Steel Industry Gets Boost, New Protective Measures
item.description: Canada is investing over $100 million starting in 2025-2026 to support its steel industry through modernization, skills development, and protection against foreign steel dumping. Measures include enhanced border controls, ending tariff remissions on imported steel by January 2026, and initiatives to reduce freight costs for Canadian steel transport. The government also plans to implement a Buy Canadian Policy to prioritize domestic steel in large contracts.

item.title: Secretary of State Belanger highlights new measures to protect and transform Canada's steel industry
item.description: Secretary of State Belanger announced new measures aimed at protecting and transforming Canada's steel industry, focusing on strengthening domestic production and competitiveness amid global trade challenges. These efforts align with broader government strategies to build a resilient and sustainable steel sector.

item.title: NTT DATA partners with Codelco on AI‑driven copper mining
item.description: NTT DATA has partnered with Codelco to implement AI-driven technologies in copper mining, aiming to enhance operational efficiency and sustainability. This collaboration represents a significant step in integrating advanced digital solutions to optimize copper extraction and processing.

item.title: Nickel price rebounds on Nov 29
item.description: On November 29, the three-month futures price of nickel on the London Metal Exchange surged by US$250/ton to US$11,055/ton, with the spot price also rising. This rebound comes amid ongoing volatility and fluctuating market sentiment.

item.title: Analysis: Nickel giants under pressure
item.description: Nickel futures prices have trended downward, reaching US$14,550 in November, one of the lowest levels since early 2021. Despite government efforts to cut mining quotas, oversupply persists, with LME inventories rising significantly.

item.title: BUMA International posts weaker 9M25, stronger 3Q recovery
item.description: BUMA International reported weaker financial results for the first nine months of 2025, but showed a stronger recovery in the third quarter. The article covers the company's performance in mining and coal operations, though specific nickel production details are not highlighted.

item.title: TGEM Targets 3,200 Tons of Class 1 Nickel MHP Production in 2025 with Enhanced STAL Technology Capabilities
item.description: Trinitan Green Energy Metals announced a strategic target to produce 3,200 tons of sustainable Class 1 nickel Mixed Hydroxide Precipitate (MHP) in 2025, leveraging enhanced STAL technology. This production ramp-up supports sustainable nickel supply for electric vehicle and high-tech industries.

item.title: Tenaris S A : Weekly Report (November 24, 2025 - November 28, 2025)
item.description: Tenaris published its weekly report covering share buyback activities from November 24-28, 2025. As of November 28, 2025, the company held 41,950,073 ordinary shares in treasury equal to 3.91% of total issued share capital. The report details share purchases across multiple trading venues with weighted average prices around EUR 17.17-17.31.

item.title: Sortera Raises $45 Million to Scale AI Driven Aluminum Upcycling
item.description: Sortera secured $45 million to expand its AI-enabled aluminum sorting platform and build a second U.S. facility in Tennessee by summer 2026. The technology transforms mixed aluminum scrap into targeted alloys, reducing energy demand by up to 95% compared to virgin metal production, significantly lowering carbon emissions and supporting domestic circular manufacturing.

item.title: The Rise of AI-Driven Aluminum Recycling and Sortera's Path to a $10B Market Opportunity
item.description: Sortera Technologies leads AI-driven aluminum recycling achieving 98% purity and 95% energy savings over primary production. Supported by $45M funding and partnerships, the company targets aerospace and automotive sectors with high-value alloy sorting, positioning the market to grow at 4.83% CAGR to 49.82 million tons by 2030, driven by ESG mandates and carbon pricing.

item.title: Belgium increased steel production by 3.4% m/m in October 2025
item.description: Belgium's steel production rose by 3.4% month-over-month in October 2025. Other notable steel market developments include Spain's 5.4% year-over-year production increase in the first half of 2025, Turkey's 8.3% production decrease in June, and ArcelorMittal's temporary blast furnace shutdown in Poland due to import pressures.

item.title: Green Steel at a Crossroads: IEEFA Says India Needs Smarter Public Financing to Drive Decarbonisation and Energy Security
item.description: India requires strategic deployment of public capital to bridge the financing gap for green steel projects and prevent carbon lock-in. The article emphasizes the importance of targeted public finance mechanisms to scale green steel production and promote sustainable steelmaking for the country's future energy security.

item.title: Super Copper and MetaFLO Announce Joint Venture to Develop Biopolymer Solutions for Copper Mining
item.description: Super Copper and MetaFLO have formed a joint venture to co-develop innovative, eco-friendly biopolymer solutions aimed at improving copper extraction and remediation. These biopolymers are designed to reduce environmental impact, optimize operational efficiency, and support regulatory compliance in copper mining, with pilot testing planned in Chile.

item.title: Off-season atmosphere deepens, proportion of liquid aluminum expected to drop further in December
item.description: Domestic aluminum production in November 2025 increased 1.47% year-on-year but fell 2.82% month-on-month as the industry transitioned into the off-season. The proportion of liquid aluminum dropped to 77.3%, with a forecasted further decline to 76.6% in December due to lower downstream demand and new processing capacity coming online.

item.title: SSAB Americas Raises Prices for Rolled Steel by at Least $40/t
item.description: For the week of November 24-30, 2025, spot prices for HRC in the U.S. increased to $915/t, up from $910/t the previous week, with thick sheet offered at $1015/t. The increase reflects tightening supply and strong demand in the North American market.

item.title: Steelmaker Nam Kim to explore tin-nickel coated steel production for EV battery shells
item.description: Vietnamese steelmaker Nam Kim plans to develop tin-nickel coated steel for electric vehicle battery shells through joint ventures with technologically capable partners. The company reported a revenue decline of 27% in Q3 2025 due to weaker market demand but is focusing on innovation in steel products for EV applications.

item.title: Steelmaker Nam Kim to explore tin-nickel coated steel production for EV battery shells
item.description: Vietnamese steelmaker Nam Kim has approved a plan to assess the feasibility of producing tin-nickel coated steel for electric vehicle battery shells. The company aims to leverage existing production capabilities and invest in new equipment, with future plans to collaborate with technically capable partners through joint ventures.

item.title: Re-energising the nickel industry through sustainable battery production
item.description: Queensland Pacific Metals is advancing sustainable nickel production through its TECH Project, which will process high-grade nickel laterite ore imported from New Caledonia using the patented DNi Process™. The project aims to be carbon negative and supply ethically derived nickel and cobalt for EV and energy storage industries, with binding offtake agreements in place with LG Energy Solution and POSCO.

item.title: The Future of Nickel Alloy Innovations in Sustainable Manufacturing
item.description: Nickel alloys are driving sustainable manufacturing by improving battery performance and longevity, reducing environmental footprints in industries such as automotive, aerospace, and energy. Innovations focus on advanced processing and recycling to create lighter, stronger, and corrosion-resistant alloys, which help reduce resource consumption and carbon emissions.

item.title: Strengthen Indonesia's Global Nickel Leadership, PT Vale Indonesia and Huayou Commits to Climate-Aligned Technology Pathways at COP30
item.description: PT Vale Indonesia is implementing technological innovations such as heat recovery, off-gas utilization, and electrification to reduce absolute emissions by 33% and carbon intensity by 50% by 2030. These efforts support climate goals and operational efficiencies, positioning Indonesia as a leader in responsible, low-carbon nickel production.

item.title: BYD's Blade Battery: Reducing Reliance on Nickel and Cobalt
item.description: BYD's Blade Battery innovation reduces reliance on nickel and cobalt, lowering ecological damage from mining and supporting sustainability goals. The company aims for carbon neutrality by 2045 and significant carbon intensity reductions by 2030, with initiatives including recycling and reuse of packaging materials to reduce industrial waste.

item.title: Climate-friendly metals can come from deep-sea ores
item.description: A new process using hydrogen reduction to extract nickel, cobalt, and copper from deep-sea ores can reduce CO2 emissions by over 90% compared to traditional carbon-based methods. This technology also requires less energy and fewer steps, offering a more sustainable approach to meeting the growing demand for critical metals in battery production.
